snippet: The education reform movement, slow economies and federal grant competitions have led lawmakers to tighten the requirements for earning and keeping tenure.
abstract: Education Department reports that nearly half of New York City teachers reaching the end of their probations were denied tenure this year, marking the culmination of years of efforts toward Mayor Michael R Bloomberg’s goal to end tenure; totals reflect a reversal in the way tenure is granted not only in New York City but around the country.
lead_paragraph: The education reform movement, slow economies and federal grant competitions have led lawmakers to tighten the requirements for earning and keeping tenure.

headline.seo: Nearly Half the Teachers in New York City Are Denied Tenure in 2012
headline.main: Many New York City Teachers Denied Tenure in Policy Shift
headline.print_headline: In Policy Shift, Fewer Teachers Are Given Tenure
